title: 113_hr4497
content: Section 1 of the bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow for the expensing of qualified disaster expenses before January 1, 2010, or during September 2013. The effective date for this amendment is after August 31, 2013. Section 2 of the bill increases the limitation on charitable contributions for disaster relief. The bill allows for the expensing of qualified disaster contributions under the Internal Revenue Code, with a limit of 80 percent of the taxpayer's contribution base. Carryover of contributions is also permitted. The bill allows for the expensing of qualified disaster contributions under the Internal Revenue Code, with a limit of 80 percent of the taxpayer's contribution base. Excess contributions will be treated as charitable contributions over 5 years. Contributions described in clause (i) are not treated as described in subparagraph (A). Qualified disaster contributions are charitable donations for relief efforts related to federally declared disasters occurring after August 31, 2013. These contributions must be made between the applicable disaster date and December 31, 2014. Qualified disaster contributions are charitable donations made in cash to eligible organizations, excluding donor advised funds. The "applicable disaster date" refers to the date of a federally declared disaster for which the contribution is intended. The text discusses the requirements for qualified disaster contributions, including the need for a written acknowledgment from the organization receiving the donation. Additionally, it mentions the redesignation of a section in the Internal Revenue Code related to corporations. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow qualified disaster contributions up to 20% of the taxpayer's taxable income over the amount of charitable contributions allowed. Excess contributions can be carried over for future use. Excess contributions can be treated as charitable contributions for 5 years. Qualified disaster contributions require substantiation from the receiving organization. The amendments made by this section apply to contributions after August 31, 2013, regarding the acknowledgment of contributions for specific purposes.
